review_text: I have stayed here before but it was a few years ago. However, the standard has continued to be high.  Very comfortable room, including the expected comforts for a good quality B&B. Good location next to the beach. Staff are very friendly. Winston was particularly helpful with my late arrival, early departure one night stay, making sure I had an excellent breakfast, next to the fireplace, before I left on that cold morning.

review_title: super fun for the whole family
review_text: Awesome spot for getting the kids to go up the supertube slide waterpark , with all the fun of the deckchairs and the cool atmosphere

Savile worked in coal mines as a teenager, reportedly sustaining spinal injuries at the age of 14, and was a Bevin Boy during the Second World War.[9] He began a career playing records in, and later managing, dance halls, and was said to have been the first disc jockey to use twin turntables to keep music in constant play. His media career started as a disc jockey at Radio Luxembourg in 1958 and on Tyne Tees Television in 1960, and he developed a reputation for eccentricity and flamboyance. At the BBC, he presented the first edition of Top of the Pops in 1964 and broadcast on Radio 1 from 1968. From 1975 until 1994, he presented Jim'll Fix It, an early Saturday evening television programme in which he arranged for the wishes of viewers, mainly children, to come true. During his lifetime, he was known for fund-raising and supporting charities and hospitals, in particular Stoke Mandeville Hospital in Aylesbury, Leeds General Infirmary and Broadmoor Hospital in Berkshire. In 2009, he was described by The Guardian as a "prodigious philanthropist"[10] and was honoured for his charity work.[11] He was awarded the OBE in 1971 and was knighted in 1990. In 2006 he introduced the last edition of Top of the Pops.
Great spot for surfer's and where surf legends practise ,a iconic Jeffrey's bay spot and good sunrise spot .

review_title: Just can't get enough mornings on this spot!!
review_text:
Make sure to turn into Pepper Street when driving in Jerseys Bay. It is really just one of those magic spots in JBay.

Can get enough of the sunrise, morning after morning.

Endless waves......

Always keep an eye out for the dolphins playing around in the waves.

Also a great site when the "surf is on" and there are loads of surfers lined up.

This is the annual surf spot with the JBay Winter Fest where surfers from all over the world visit.

review_title: Most beautiful waves, rock pools and beach!
review_text: What a breathtaking beach and view! The notorious surf spot-in the top 5 waves of the world... the beach is very clean and has some wooden walkways to walk on along the beach. There’s beautiful Little Rock pools at low tide and a long stretch of beach to walk along. Lots of shells to pick up and beautiful sunrises to watch. There’s little shops where you could buy memorabilia as well! You cannot miss this beautiful beach when visiting Jeffreys Bay!

review_title: An amazing spot on the coastline!
review_text: Such is the popularity of Supertubes that we have found it better to visit off-season, as then we can be gauranteed of a parking place relatively close by. Even during off-season,  intrepid surfers can be seen riding the waves and at this time of the year, the lookout point above Supers is good for whale watching!

We regularly frequent Supertubes in Pepper Street, Jeffreys Bay; home of a near perfect wave; where pro's and amateurs carve up the wall, hang into the tube and generally get stoked at this sought after Surfing Destination.

This place is beautiful. You have the beach, the water slides, the pool, sun, sea and sand at it's best. This are is ideal for swimming, body surfing, playing on the sand, long walk, restaurants, etc - all there together and free & safe parking.

I stayed at Supertubes for a business trip 26-27 September, it was my second visit to Supertubes and as per my previous visit I must say that it was Super.
The staff are super friendly and professional and they went out of their way to make me feel welcome.
The food was tasty and the barbecue that they arranged for us on the evening of the business trip was SUPER. I would like to commend the guys who did the "braai".
I stayed in room no.8 on the ground floor and was SUPER impressed with how neat and tidy the place was.

Supertubes is a fabulous beach to visit. At low tide the rock pools are open and make for lovely splash pools for toddlers.
If you're an experienced surfer, this break is also great.
There's a little restaurant in the Supertubes guesthouse just up on the hill and other shops and restaurants aren't too far away.
You cld just sit on the boardwalk and watch the surfing with a coffee or walk for miles on the sand in the summer or winter.
I live here, and it's one of my favorite beaches.

With waves so big not a bad places to sit back and watch the sights.
I'm a newby to Jeffries Bay but I loved the view, the surfers put on a huge display of tricks.
Take a camera. A chilled coolsrink and relax for the day.

review_title: amazing waves, nice beach, friendly area
review_text: We enjoyed sitting on the beach and watching the surfers. Lots of people walking around,also kids and dogs. Also fun to catch a wave there if you can surf. Very chilly in winter, need lots of layers!
Great reception on arrival, excellent comfortable room with all amenities, super breakfast - amazing value for money.
Mini Putt Putt an okay day activity. Fun for kids. Not too much to do in Jbay so this is normally on the list
It's a surfing spot but it's a beautiful place to just get a little sun and a relax for a bit while you enjoy the view. Worth the visit!!

This is one of the best waves in the world, so it can get quite crowded with locals and foreigners. No matter how many people are out there, you always get waves though. Respect the locals and you won't have any issues.

review_title: Lovely guesthouse, right on the beach
review_text:
Very friendly reception on arrival. Nice clean rooms, comfy beds. Nice view from balcony. Walk down the garden onto beach or across the road to shops.
Lovely breakfast. Would definitely stay here again.

Recommendable even if there are no big waves
If there arme no surfer, you have the chance to see dolphins
Clean beach with a lot of seating accomodations on the dunes
It was a nice experience and alot of fun but me being a teenager I felt very uncomfortable with the guys looking at me the hole time but again alot of fun

We took our sons to the Supertubes in Jeffreys Bay and they had so much fun. They did a round of Mini Golf before going for their first slide into the water. There is life gaurds present at all times who make sure that the kids are safe and that they get out of the pool as soon as possible so that they don't interfere with other kids coming down the slide.  Our kids had so much fun and did not want to go home
Wow what an awesome experience! Good food, excellent sitting stands and set-up with big screens! best of all was watching the surfing from high up! Very friendly vibe!

This has been voted several times to be one of the top 5 beaches in the world for surfing. If you just want to swim in the sea or body surf or spend a day tanning and relaxing, it will certainly also receive 5 full stars. One of the best beaches in the world, no doubt about it. Ensure you have a good 40+ sun-factor sunscreen, the African sun is not something to play with.

Surfing in JBay is some of the best in the world!  My husband is from JBay, and he enjoyed coming back to surf at Super Tubes, and I enjoy watching.  You can go out in the morning and find people already out watching and relaxing for hours.  The view is unmatched, and the relaxed and care free.  No fighting over waves, but the locals don't exactly want to advertise to the new-comers, so the main sign has graffiti over it!  Beginners may not wish to risk the surf, but on a calm day it's fun for all.  Enough beach to grab towels and friends and relax all day!  There are also benches and a park down the road.

My husband is a surfer so I am familiar with what is special about Supertubes. I must say one can get lost for hours watching the better surfers at Supertubes. This beach should be marine protected to preserve the natural wonder.

The best righthanded wave in the entire planet. And surprinsingly not half as crowded as I expected. The place is beautiful and worth a visit even for non surfers. But surfers need to go there at least once in a lifetime.
Great views of the sea. A surfers paradise. have watched both dolphins and whales here. Can get very busy but a place that you must visit.
Close to the beach , perfect setup if you area surfer.If not take a walk along the coastline and enjoy the salt water air.
Updated website with daily specials and changes depending on the weather. Safe interesting place for kids to hang out with or without their parents

it is easy to see why Jeffrey's Bay is considered a surfing paradise, not only locally, but internationally. Here at Supertubes, the land rises more sharply from the shore, affording an absolutely stunning view of the surfers catching the break,with the whole wide sweep of the bay visible on clear days. Dophin and whale sightings are commonplace from this vantage point too.
Although tiered benches have been provided at different points along the boardwalk, there are no ablution facilites at all. The other downside is that parking is limited, very limited, so plan accordingly!

Supertubes is a fabulous beach to visit. At low tide the rock pools are open and make for lovely splash pools for toddlers.
If you're an experienced surfer, this break is also great.
There's a little restaurant in the Supertubes guesthouse just up on the hill and other shops and restaurants aren't too far away.
You cld just sit on the boardwalk and watch the surfing with a coffee or walk for miles on the sand in the summer or winter.
I live here, and it's one of my favorite beaches.

With waves so big not a bad places to sit back and watch the sights.
I'm a newby to Jeffries Bay but I loved the view, the surfers put on a huge display of tricks.
Take a camera. A chilled coolsrink and relax for the day.
